alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued January 25 at 5:11AM PST until January 25 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, stagnant air is expected, which may lead to deteriorating air quality. For the Freezing Fog Advisory, visibility of one quarter of a mile or less in freezing fog. * WHERE...Valleys in eastern Curry and Josephine Counties, including the Rogue, Illinois and Applegate valleys. * WHEN...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 4 AM PST Saturday. For the Freezing Fog Advisory, until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility in fog and potential frost on bridges. Air stagnation could result in the development and persistence of deteriorating air quality. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Also, be alert for frost on bridge decks causing slippery roads. People with respiratory illness should follow their physician`s advice for dealing with diminished air quality. N95 masks are effective at filtering out the majority of harmful air particulates. State air quality agencies highly recommend that no outdoor burning occur and that residential wood burning devices be limited as much as possible. According to state air quality agencies, prolonged periods of stagnant air can hold pollutants close to the ground where people live and breathe. Check with your local burn agency for any current restrictions in your area.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
